text:
Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Strategy > 1-1-1
The cybersecurity strategy of the entity shall be identified, documented, and approved, and it shall be supported by the head of the entity or his/her delegate. The strategy goals shall be in line with the relevant legislative and regulatory requirements.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Strategy > 1-1-2
The entity shall execute an action plan to apply the cybersecurity strategy.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Strategy > 1-1-3
The cybersecurity strategy shall be reviewed at planned intervals (or in case of changes to the relevant legislative and regulatory requirements).

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Management > 1-2-1
A department for cybersecurity shall be established within the entity. This department shall be independent from the Information Technology and Communications Department. It is recommended that the Cybersecurity Department reports directly to the head of the entity or his/her delegate while ensuring that this does not result in a conflict of interests.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Management > 1-2-2
All cybersecurity positions shall be filled out with full-time and qualified Saudi cybersecurity professionals.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Management > 1-2-3
A cybersecurity supervisory committee shall be established pursuant to the instruction of the entity's Authorized Official to ensure compliance with, support for, and monitoring of the implementation of the cybersecurity programs and regulations.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Policies and Procedures > 1-3-1
The cybersecurity department of the entity shall identify and document cybersecurity policies and procedures, including the cybersecurity controls and requirements, and have them approved by the entity's Authorized Official.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Policies and Procedures > 1-3-2
The cybersecurity department shall ensure that the cybersecurity policies and procedures, including the relevant controls and requirements, are implemented at the entity.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Policies and Procedures > 1-3-3
The cybersecurity policies and procedures shall be supported by technical security standards (e.g. technical security standards for firewall, databases, operating systems, etc.).

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Policies and Procedures > 1-3-4
The cybersecurity policies and procedures shall be reviewed and updated at planned intervals (or in case of changes to the relevant legislative and regulatory requirements and standards).

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Roles and Responsibilities > 1-4-1
The Authorized Official shall identify, document, and approve the governance organizational structure, roles, and responsibilities of the entity's cybersecurity, and assign the persons concerned therewith.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Roles and Responsibilities > 1-4-2
The cybersecurity roles and responsibilities within the entity shall be reviewed and updated at planned intervals (or in case of changes to the relevant legislative and regulatory requirements).

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Risk Management > 1-5-1
The cybersecurity department of the entity shall identify, document, and approve the cybersecurity risk management methodology and procedures within the entity, in accordance with considerations of confidentiality, and the integrity and availability of information and technology assets.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Risk Management > 1-5-2
The cybersecurity department shall implement the cybersecurity risk management methodology and procedures within the entity.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Risk Management > 1-5-3
The cybersecurity risk assessment procedures shall be implemented at least in the following cases:

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Risk Management > 1-5-3 > 1-5-3-1
At early stage of technology projects.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Risk Management > 1-5-3 > 1-5-3-2
Before making major changes to technology infrastructure.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Risk Management > 1-5-3 > 1-5-3-3
During planning to obtain third party services.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Risk Management > 1-5-3 > 1-5-3-4
During planning and before the release of new technology services and products.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Risk Management > 1-5-4
The cybersecurity risk management methodology and procedures shall be reviewed and updated at planned intervals (or in case of changes to the relevant legislative and regulatory requirements and standards).

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity in Information and Technology Project Management > 1-6-1
Cybersecurity requirements shall be included in the project management methodology and procedures and in the information and technology asset change management within the entity.

Reviewing secure configuration and hardening and updates packages before launching projects and changes.

The cybersecurity requirements for software and application development projects within the entity shall include the following as a minimum:

Using the secure coding standards.

meta.subdomain_name: Cybersecurity in Information and Technology Project Management

Using trusted and licensed sources for software development tools and libraries.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity in Information and Technology Project Management > 1-6-3 > 1-6-3-3
Conducting compliance test for software against the cybersecurity requirements within the entity.

meta.subdomain_name: Cybersecurity in Information and Technology Project Management

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity in Information and Technology Project Management > 1-6-3 > 1-6-3-4
Secure integration between applications.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity in Information and Technology Project Management > 1-6-3 > 1-6-3-5
Reviewing secure configuration and hardening and updates packages before launching software products.

text:
Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity in Information and Technology Project Management > 1-6-4
The cybersecurity requirements for project management within the entity shall be periodically reviewed.

text:
Cybersecurity Governance > Compliance with Cybersecurity Standards, Laws and Regulations > 1-7-1
If there are nationally approved international agreements or commitments that include cybersecurity requirements, the entity shall identify and comply with these requirements.

meta.subdomain_name: Compliance with Cybersecurity Standards, Laws and Regulations

text:
Cybersecurity Governance > Periodical Cybersecurity Review and Audit > 1-8-1
The cybersecurity department of the entity shall periodically review the implementation of cybersecurity controls by the entity.

Cybersecurity Governance > Periodical Cybersecurity Review and Audit > 1-8-2
The implementation of cybersecurity controls by the entity shall be reviewed and audited by parties other than the cybersecurity department at the entity, provided that the audit and review are to be conducted independently.

Cybersecurity Governance > Periodical Cybersecurity Review and Audit > 1-8-3
The results of cybersecurity audits and reviews shall be documented and presented to the cybersecurity supervisory committee and the Authorized Official.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity in Human Resources > 1-9-1
Cybersecurity requirements for personnel of the entity shall be identified, documented, and approved prior to, during, and upon the end or termination of their employment.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity in Human Resources > 1-9-2
Cybersecurity requirements for personnel of the entity shall be implemented.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity in Human Resources > 1-9-3
Cybersecurity requirements prior to the commencement of the employment relationship between personnel and the entity shall include the following as a minimum:

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity in Human Resources > 1-9-3 > 1-9-3-1
Incorporating the personnel's cybersecurity responsibilities clauses and non-disclosure clauses in their employment contracts.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity in Human Resources > 1-9-3 > 1-9-3-2
Conducting screening or vetting for personnel in cybersecurity positions and technical positions with critical and privileged powers.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity in Human Resources > 1-9-4
Cybersecurity requirements for personnel during their employment relationship with the entity shall include the following as a minimum:

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity in Human Resources > 1-9-4 > 1-9-4-1
Cybersecurity awareness (during on-boarding and during employment).

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity in Human Resources > 1-9-4 > 1-9-4-2
Implementation and compliance with cybersecurity requirements, as per the entity's cybersecurity policies, procedures, and operations.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity in Human Resources > 1-9-5
The personnel's powers shall be reviewed and revoked immediately upon the end/termination of their employment with the entity.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity in Human Resources > 1-9-6
Cybersecurity requirements for personnel of the entity shall be periodically reviewed.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Awareness and Training Program > 1-10-1
A cybersecurity awareness program, delivered through multiple channels, shall be periodically developed and approved by the entity.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Awareness and Training Program > 1-10-2
The approved cybersecurity awareness program shall be implemented within the entity.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Awareness and Training Program > 1-10-3
The cybersecurity awareness program shall include how to protect the entity against the most important and latest cyber risks and threats, including:

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Awareness and Training Program > 1-10-3 > 1-10-3-1
Secure handling of email services, especially phishing emails.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Awareness and Training Program > 1-10-3 > 1-10-3-2
Secure handling of mobile devices and storage media.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Awareness and Training Program > 1-10-3 > 1-10-3-3
Secure Internet browsing.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Awareness and Training Program > 1-10-3 > 1-10-3-4
Secure usage of social media.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Awareness and Training Program > 1-10-4
Specialized skills and necessary training shall be provided to personnel in positions that are linked directly to cybersecurity within the entity.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Awareness and Training Program > 1-10-4 > 1-10-4-1
Cybersecurity department personnel.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Awareness and Training Program > 1-10-4 > 1-10-4-2
Personnel working on software/application development and those working on information and technology assets of the entity.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Awareness and Training Program > 1-10-4 > 1-10-4-3
Executive and supervisory positions.

Cybersecurity Governance > Cybersecurity Awareness and Training Program > 1-10-5
The implementation of cybersecurity awareness program within the entity shall be periodically reviewed.

Cybersecurity Defense > Asset Management > 2-1-1
Cybersecurity requirements for managing information and technology assets of the entity shall be identified, documented, and approved.

Cybersecurity Defense > Asset Management > 2-1-2
Cybersecurity requirements for managing information and technology assets of the entity shall be implemented.

Cybersecurity Defense > Asset Management > 2-1-3
The policy of acceptable use of information and technology assets of the entity shall be identified, documented, approved, and communicated.

Cybersecurity Defense > Asset Management > 2-1-4
The policy of acceptable use of information and technology assets of the entity shall be implemented.

Cybersecurity Defense > Asset Management > 2-1-5
Information and technology assets of the entity shall be classified, labeled, and handled as per the relevant legislative and regulatory requirements.

Cybersecurity Defense > Asset Management > 2-1-6
Cybersecurity requirements for managing information and technology assets of the entity shall be periodically reviewed.

Cybersecurity Defense > Identity and Access Management > 2-2-1
Cybersecurity requirements for identity and access management of the entity shall be identified, documented, and approved.

Cybersecurity Defense > Identity and Access Management > 2-2-2
Cybersecurity requirements for identity and access management of the entity shall be implemented.

Cybersecurity Defense > Identity and Access Management > 2-2-3
Cybersecurity requirements for identity and access management of the entity shall include the following as a minimum:

Cybersecurity Defense > Identity and Access Management > 2-2-3 > 2-2-3-1
Single-factor authentication based on username and password.

Cybersecurity Defense > Identity and Access Management > 2-2-3 > 2-2-3-2
Multi-factor authentication, and defining the suitable authentication factors and their numbers as well as the suitable authentication techniques based on the result of impact assessment of authentication failure and bypass for remote access and for privileged accounts.

Cybersecurity Defense > Identity and Access Management > 2-2-3 > 2-2-3-3
User authorization based on identity and access control principles (Need-to-Know and Need-to-Use principle, Least Privilege principle, and Segregation of Duties principle).

Cybersecurity Defense > Identity and Access Management > 2-2-3 > 2-2-3-4
Privileged access management.

Cybersecurity Defense > Identity and Access Management > 2-2-3 > 2-2-3-5
Periodic review of identities and access rights.

Cybersecurity Defense > Identity and Access Management > 2-2-4
The implementation of cybersecurity requirements for identity and access management of the entity shall be periodically reviewed.

Cybersecurity Defense > Information System and Processing Facilities Protection > 2-3-1
Cybersecurity requirements for protection of information system and processing facilities of the entity shall be identified, documented, and approved.

Cybersecurity requirements for protection of information systems and processing facilities of the entity shall be implemented.

Cybersecurity requirements for protection of information systems and processing facilities of the entity shall include the following as a minimum:

Protection from viruses, suspicious programs and activities, and malware on workstations and servers, using modern and advanced protection technologies and mechanisms.

meta.subdomain_name: Information System and Processing Facilities Protection

text:
Cybersecurity Defense > Information System and Processing Facilities Protection > 2-3-3 > 2-3-3-2
Strict restriction on the use of external storage media and their security.

meta.subdomain_name: Information System and Processing Facilities Protection

text:
Cybersecurity Defense > Information System and Processing Facilities Protection > 2-3-3 > 2-3-3-3
Patch management for systems, applications, and devices.

meta.subdomain_name: Information System and Processing Facilities Protection

Cybersecurity Defense > Information System and Processing Facilities Protection > 2-3-3 > 2-3-3-4
Centralized clock synchronization with an accurate and trusted source, such as sources provided by the Saudi Standards, Metrology and Quality Organization (SASO).

Cybersecurity Defense > Information System and Processing Facilities Protection > 2-3-4
The implementation of cybersecurity requirements for protection of the information system and processing facilities of the entity shall be periodically reviewed.

text:
Cybersecurity Defense > Email Protection > 2-4-1
Cybersecurity requirements for protection of the email service of the entity shall be identified, documented, and approved.

Cybersecurity Defense > Email Protection > 2-4-2
Cybersecurity requirements for protection of email service of the entity shall be implemented.

Cybersecurity Defense > Email Protection > 2-4-3
Cybersecurity requirements for protection of the email service of the entity shall include the following as a minimum:

Cybersecurity Defense > Email Protection > 2-4-3 > 2-4-3-1
Analyzing and filtering email messages (specifically phishing emails and spam emails) using modern and advanced email protection techniques and mechanisms.

Cybersecurity Defense > Email Protection > 2-4-3 > 2-4-3-2
Multi-factor authentication, and defining the suitable authentication factors and their numbers as well as the suitable authentication techniques based on the result of impact assessment of authentication failure and bypass for remote and webmail access.

Cybersecurity Defense > Email Protection > 2-4-3 > 2-4-3-3
Email archiving and backup.

Cybersecurity Defense > Email Protection > 2-4-3 > 2-4-3-4
Secure management and protection against Advanced Persistent Threats (APT), which normally utilize zero-day malware and viruses.

Cybersecurity Defense > Email Protection > 2-4-3 > 2-4-3-5
Validation of the entity's email service domains by using Sender Policy Framework (SPF), Domain Keys Identified Mail (DKIM), and Domain Message Authentication Reporting and Conformance (DMARC).

Cybersecurity Defense > Email Protection > 2-4-4
The implementation of cybersecurity requirements for email service of the entity shall be periodically reviewed.

Cybersecurity Defense > Networks Security Management > 2-5-1
Cybersecurity requirements for the entity's network security management shall be identified, documented, and approved.

Cybersecurity Defense > Networks Security Management > 2-5-2
Cybersecurity requirements for the entity's network security management shall be implemented.

Cybersecurity Defense > Networks Security Management > 2-5-3
Cybersecurity requirements for the entity's network security management shall include the following as a minimum:

Cybersecurity Defense > Networks Security Management > 2-5-3 > 2-5-3-1
Logical or physical isolation and segmentation of network segments in a secure manner which is required to control relevant cybersecurity risks, using firewall and defense-in-depth principle.

Cybersecurity Defense > Networks Security Management > 2-5-3 > 2-5-3-2
Isolation of production network from testing and development environment networks.

Cybersecurity Defense > Networks Security Management > 2-5-3 > 2-5-3-3
Secure browsing and internet connectivity, including strict restrictions on suspicious websites, file storage/sharing websites, and remote access websites.

Cybersecurity Defense > Networks Security Management > 2-5-3 > 2-5-3-4
Wireless network security and protection using secure authentication and encryption techniques and avoiding the connection of wireless networks to the entity's internal network.

Cybersecurity Defense > Networks Security Management > 2-5-3 > 2-5-3-5
Restricting and managing network services, protocols, and ports.

Cybersecurity Defense > Networks Security Management > 2-5-3 > 2-5-3-6
Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS).

Cybersecurity Defense > Networks Security Management > 2-5-3 > 2-5-3-7
Security of Domain Name Service (DNS).

Cybersecurity Defense > Networks Security Management > 2-5-3 > 2-5-3-8
Secure management and protection of Internet browsing channel against Advanced Persistent Threats (APT), which normally utilize zero-day malware and viruses.

Cybersecurity Defense > Networks Security Management > 2-5-3 > 2-5-3-9
Protecting against Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks to limit risks arising from these attacks.

Cybersecurity Defense > Networks Security Management > 2-5-4
The implementation of cybersecurity requirements for the entity's network security management shall be periodically reviewed.

Cybersecurity Defense > Mobile Devices Security > 2-6-1
Cybersecurity requirements for mobile devices and BYOD security when connected to the entity's network shall be identified, documented, and approved.

Cybersecurity Defense > Mobile Devices Security > 2-6-2
Cybersecurity requirements for mobile devices and BYOD security of the entity shall be implemented.

Cybersecurity Defense > Mobile Devices Security > 2-6-3
Cybersecurity requirements for mobile devices and BYOD security of the entity shall include the following as a minimum:

Cybersecurity Defense > Mobile Devices Security > 2-6-3 > 2-6-3-1
Separation and encryption of the entity's data and information stored on mobile devices and BYODs.

Cybersecurity Defense > Mobile Devices Security > 2-6-3 > 2-6-3-2
Controlled and restricted use based on the requirements of the interest of the entity's business.

Cybersecurity Defense > Mobile Devices Security > 2-6-3 > 2-6-3-3
Deletion of the entity's data and information stored on mobile devices and BYOD in cases of device loss or after the ending/termination of employment with the entity.

Cybersecurity Defense > Mobile Devices Security > 2-6-3 > 2-6-3-4
Security awareness for users.

Cybersecurity Defense > Mobile Devices Security > 2-6-4
The implementation of cybersecurity requirements for mobile devices and BYOD security of the entity shall be periodically reviewed.

Cybersecurity Defense > Data and Information Protection > 2-7-1
Cybersecurity requirements for protecting and handling data and information of the entity shall be identified, documented, and approved, as per the relevant legislative and regulatory requirements.

Cybersecurity Defense > Data and Information Protection > 2-7-2
Cybersecurity requirements for protecting data and information of the entity shall be implemented, based on its classification level.

Cybersecurity Defense > Data and Information Protection > 2-7-3
The implementation of cybersecurity requirements for protecting data and information of the entity shall be periodically reviewed.

Cybersecurity Defense > Cryptography > 2-8-1
Cybersecurity requirements for cryptography within the entity shall be identified, documented, and approved.

Cybersecurity Defense > Cryptography > 2-8-2
Cybersecurity requirements for cryptography within the entity shall be implemented.

Cybersecurity Defense > Cryptography > 2-8-3
Cybersecurity requirements for cryptography shall include at least the requirements in the National Cryptographic Standards, published by NCA.

Cybersecurity Defense > Cryptography > 2-8-3 > 2-8-3-1
Approved cryptographic systems and solutions standards and their technical and regulatory restrictions.

Cybersecurity Defense > Cryptography > 2-8-3 > 2-8-3-2
Secure management of cryptographic keys during their lifecycles.

Cybersecurity Defense > Cryptography > 2-8-3 > 2-8-3-3
Encryption of data in-transit and at-rest, as per their classification and the relevant legislative and regulatory requirements.

Cybersecurity Defense > Cryptography > 2-8-4
The implementation of cybersecurity requirements for cryptography within the entity shall be periodically reviewed.

Cybersecurity Defense > Backup and Recovery Management > 2-9-1
Cybersecurity requirements for backup and recovery management within the entity shall be identified, documented, and approved.

Cybersecurity Defense > Backup and Recovery Management > 2-9-2
Cybersecurity requirements for backup and recovery management within the entity shall be implemented.

Cybersecurity Defense > Backup and Recovery Management > 2-9-3
Cybersecurity requirements for backup and recovery management shall include the following as a minimum:

Cybersecurity Defense > Backup and Recovery Management > 2-9-3 > 2-9-3-1
Scope of backups to cover critical technology and information assets.

Cybersecurity Defense > Backup and Recovery Management > 2-9-3 > 2-9-3-2
Ability to perform quick recovery of data and systems after cybersecurity incidents.

Cybersecurity Defense > Backup and Recovery Management > 2-9-3 > 2-9-3-3
Periodic testing for the effectiveness of backup recovery.

Cybersecurity Defense > Backup and Recovery Management > 2-9-4
The implementation of cybersecurity requirements for backup and recovery management within the entity shall be periodically reviewed.

Cybersecurity Defense > Vulnerabilities Management > 2-10-1
Cybersecurity requirements for technical vulnerabilities management within the entity shall be identified, documented, and approved.

Cybersecurity Defense > Vulnerabilities Management > 2-10-2
Cybersecurity requirements for technical vulnerabilities management within the entity shall be implemented.

Cybersecurity Defense > Vulnerabilities Management > 2-10-3
Cybersecurity requirements for technical vulnerabilities management shall include the following as a minimum:

Cybersecurity Defense > Vulnerabilities Management > 2-10-3 > 2-10-3-1
Periodic vulnerabilities assessment and detection.

Cybersecurity Defense > Vulnerabilities Management > 2-10-3 > 2-10-3-2
Vulnerabilities classification based on their severities.

Cybersecurity Defense > Vulnerabilities Management > 2-10-3 > 2-10-3-3
Vulnerabilities remediation based on their classification and the associated cyber risks.

Cybersecurity Defense > Vulnerabilities Management > 2-10-3 > 2-10-3-4
Patch management to remediate vulnerabilities, and ensuring the integrity and effectiveness of these updates and fixes are verified using a non-production environment before being applied.

Cybersecurity Defense > Vulnerabilities Management > 2-10-3 > 2-10-3-5
Communication and subscription with trusted resources for new and up-to-date vulnerabilities.

Cybersecurity Defense > Vulnerabilities Management > 2-10-4
The implementation of cybersecurity requirements for technical vulnerabilities management within the entity shall be periodically reviewed.

Cybersecurity Defense > Penetration Testing > 2-11-1
Cybersecurity requirements for penetration testing within the entity shall be identified, documented, and approved.

Cybersecurity Defense > Penetration Testing > 2-11-2
Cybersecurity requirements for penetration testing within the entity shall be implemented.

Cybersecurity Defense > Penetration Testing > 2-11-3
Cybersecurity requirements for penetration testing shall include the following as a minimum:

Cybersecurity Defense > Penetration Testing > 2-11-3 > 2-11-3-1
Scope of penetration testing to include all externally provided services (via the Internet) and their technical components, including infrastructure, websites, web applications, smartphone and tablet applications, email, and remote access.

Cybersecurity Defense > Penetration Testing > 2-11-3 > 2-11-3-2
Conducting penetration tests periodically.

Cybersecurity Defense > Penetration Testing > 2-11-4
The implementation of cybersecurity requirements for penetration testing shall be periodically reviewed.

Cybersecurity Defense > Cybersecurity Event Logs and Monitoring Management > 2-12-1
Cybersecurity requirements for cybersecurity event logs and monitoring management within the entity shall be identified, documented, and approved.

Cybersecurity requirements for cybersecurity event logs and monitoring management within the entity shall be implemented.

Cybersecurity requirements for cybersecurity event logs and monitoring management shall include the following as a minimum:

Activation of cybersecurity event logs for critical information assets within the entity.

Cybersecurity Defense > Cybersecurity Event Logs and Monitoring Management > 2-12-3 > 2-12-3-2
Activation of cybersecurity event logs for critical and privileged accounts accessing information assets as well as for remote access events within the entity.

meta.subdomain_name: Cybersecurity Event Logs and Monitoring Management

text:
Cybersecurity Defense > Cybersecurity Event Logs and Monitoring Management > 2-12-3 > 2-12-3-3
Identification of Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) techniques required for cybersecurity event logs collection.

meta.subdomain_name: Cybersecurity Event Logs and Monitoring Management

Cybersecurity Defense > Cybersecurity Event Logs and Monitoring Management > 2-12-3 > 2-12-3-4
Continuous monitoring of cybersecurity event logs.

Retention period of cybersecurity event logs (shall be at least 12 months).

Cybersecurity Defense > Cybersecurity Event Logs and Monitoring Management > 2-12-4
The implementation of cybersecurity requirements for cybersecurity event logs and monitoring management within the entity shall be periodically reviewed.

text:
Cybersecurity Defense > Cybersecurity Incident and Threat Management > 2-13-1
Requirements for cybersecurity incident and threat management within the entity shall be identified, documented, and approved.

Cybersecurity Defense > Cybersecurity Incident and Threat Management > 2-13-2
Requirements for cybersecurity incident and threat management within the entity shall be implemented.

Cybersecurity Defense > Cybersecurity Incident and Threat Management > 2-13-3
Requirements for cybersecurity incident and threat management shall include the following as a minimum:

Cybersecurity Defense > Cybersecurity Incident and Threat Management > 2-13-3 > 2-13-3-1
Cybersecurity incident response plans and escalation procedures.

Cybersecurity Defense > Cybersecurity Incident and Threat Management > 2-13-3 > 2-13-3-2
Cybersecurity incident classification.

Cybersecurity Defense > Cybersecurity Incident and Threat Management > 2-13-3 > 2-13-3-3
Reporting cybersecurity incidents to the NCA.

Cybersecurity Defense > Cybersecurity Incident and Threat Management > 2-13-3 > 2-13-3-4
Sharing cybersecurity incident notifications, threat intelligence, penetration indicators, and incident reports with the NCA.

Cybersecurity Defense > Cybersecurity Incident and Threat Management > 2-13-3 > 2-13-3-5
Collecting and handling threat intelligence feeds.

Cybersecurity Defense > Cybersecurity Incident and Threat Management > 2-13-4
The implementation of cybersecurity requirements for incident and threat management within the entity shall be periodically reviewed.

Cybersecurity Defense > Physical Security > 2-14-1
Cybersecurity requirements for protection of information and technology assets of the entity against unauthorized physical access, loss, theft, and damage shall be identified, documented, and approved.

Cybersecurity Defense > Physical Security > 2-14-2
Cybersecurity requirements for protection of information and technology assets of the entity against unauthorized physical access, loss, theft, and damage shall be implemented.

Cybersecurity Defense > Physical Security > 2-14-3
Cybersecurity requirements for protection of information and technology assets shall include the following as a minimum:

Cybersecurity Defense > Physical Security > 2-14-3 > 2-14-3-1
Authorized access to critical areas within the entity (e.g. the entity's data center, disaster recovery center, critical information processing facilities, security surveillance center, network connection rooms, technical device and equipment supply areas, etc.).

Cybersecurity Defense > Physical Security > 2-14-3 > 2-14-3-2
Access and monitoring logs (CCTV).

Cybersecurity Defense > Physical Security > 2-14-3 > 2-14-3-3
Protection of access and monitoring log information.

Cybersecurity Defense > Physical Security > 2-14-3 > 2-14-3-4
Security of the destruction and re-use of physical assets that hold classified information (including paper documents and storage media).

Cybersecurity Defense > Physical Security > 2-14-3 > 2-14-3-5
Security of devices and equipment inside and outside the entity's facilities.

Cybersecurity Defense > Physical Security > 2-14-4
Cybersecurity requirements for protection of information and technology assets of the entity against unauthorized physical access, loss, theft, and damage shall be periodically reviewed.

Cybersecurity Defense > Web Application Security > 2-15-1
Cybersecurity requirements for protection of external web applications of the entity shall be identified, documented, and approved.

Cybersecurity Defense > Web Application Security > 2-15-2
Cybersecurity requirements for protection of external web applications of the entity shall be implemented.

Cybersecurity Defense > Web Application Security > 2-15-3
Cybersecurity requirements for protection of external web applications of the entity shall include the following as a minimum:

Cybersecurity Defense > Web Application Security > 2-15-3 > 2-15-3-1
Use of web application firewall.

Adoption of the multi-tier architecture principle.

Third-Party and Cloud Computing Cybersecurity > Third-Party Cybersecurity > 4-1-1
Cybersecurity requirements for the entity's contracts and agreements with third parties shall be identified, documented, and approved.

Third-Party and Cloud Computing Cybersecurity > Third-Party Cybersecurity > 4-1-2
Cybersecurity requirements for contracts and agreements with third parties shall include the following as a minimum:

Third-Party and Cloud Computing Cybersecurity > Third-Party Cybersecurity > 4-1-2 > 4-1-2-1
Clauses of non-disclosure and the secure removal of the entity's data by the third party upon the end of service.

Third-Party and Cloud Computing Cybersecurity > Third-Party Cybersecurity > 4-1-2 > 4-1-2-2
Communication procedures in case of the occurrence of a cybersecurity incident.

Third-Party and Cloud Computing Cybersecurity > Third-Party Cybersecurity > 4-1-2 > 4-1-2-3
Obligating the third party to apply the entity's cybersecurity requirements and policies and the relevant legislative and regulatory requirements.

Third-Party and Cloud Computing Cybersecurity > Third-Party Cybersecurity > 4-1-3
Cybersecurity requirements for contracts and agreements with third parties providing IT or cybersecurity outsourcing or managed services shall include the following as a minimum:

Third-Party and Cloud Computing Cybersecurity > Third-Party Cybersecurity > 4-1-3 > 4-1-3-1
Conducting a cybersecurity risk assessment and ensuring the availability of risk mitigation controls before signing contracts and agreements or upon making changes to the relevant legislative and regulatory requirements.

Third-Party and Cloud Computing Cybersecurity > Third-Party Cybersecurity > 4-1-3 > 4-1-3-2
Cybersecurity managed service centers for monitoring and operations which use remote access shall be fully located in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.

Third-Party and Cloud Computing Cybersecurity > Third-Party Cybersecurity > 4-1-4
Cybersecurity requirements for third parties shall be periodically reviewed.

Cybersecurity requirements for use of cloud computing and hosting services shall be identified, documented, and approved.

Third-Party and Cloud Computing Cybersecurity > Cloud Computing and Hosting Cybersecurity > 4-2-2
Cybersecurity requirements for the cloud computing and hosting services within the entity shall be implemented.

Third-Party and Cloud Computing Cybersecurity > Cloud Computing and Hosting Cybersecurity > 4-2-3
Cybersecurity requirements for use of cloud computing and hosting services shall include the following as a minimum:

Third-Party and Cloud Computing Cybersecurity > Cloud Computing and Hosting Cybersecurity > 4-2-3 > 4-2-3-1
Protection of entity's data by cloud and hosting service providers in accordance with its classification level and returning data (in a usable format) upon service completion.

Third-Party and Cloud Computing Cybersecurity > Cloud Computing and Hosting Cybersecurity > 4-2-3 > 4-2-3-2
Separation of the entity's environment (especially virtual servers) from environments of other entities within the cloud computing service provider.

Third-Party and Cloud Computing Cybersecurity > Cloud Computing and Hosting Cybersecurity > 4-2-4
Cybersecurity requirements for cloud computing and hosting services shall be periodically reviewed.
